page.title: 11St Cuthbert's H.S Johnstone
page.content: St Cuthbert's is a purpose built Roman Catholic co-educational 6 year comprehensive school, serving the population of Johnstone and its environs.It provides education through from first to sixth year, presenting pupils for C.S.E. examinations at 'O', standard and 'H' grade and Certificate of Sixth Year Studies. It is situated on the south western boundary of the town and was opened in 1972 by Bishop McGill. The present roll is 851 and there are 62 teachers, only 12 of whom were here in 1972. The roll of the school remained at approximately 1000 from 1972 to 1983. Then the roll began to fall, and by 1992 the roll is expected to be less than 500.This will have grave implications for the school's future.
